Activity: Log in to the EHR system and review any new updates or alerts. Check emails for urgent messages from colleagues or supervisors.
Attend a quick huddle with @rn-1, @rn-3 and @clinlead-1 to discuss patient assignments and any specific concerns for the day. Get a sense of the patient flow and anticipated workload.

Begin initial patient assessments. Focus on gathering comprehensive patient histories, including current medications, allergies, and relevant past medical conditions. Meticulously enter all data into the EHR, double-checking for accuracy.

Administer influenza vaccinations to scheduled patients. Ensure proper technique and document the date, time, vaccine lot number, and injection site in the EHR. Provide patients with post-vaccination instructions.
Lunch Break - Head to the break room and chat with @mrs-1 and @helpdesk-1 about the latest hospital gossip and weekend plans.
Continue patient assessments and EHR data entry. Prioritize patients presenting with urgent needs or requiring immediate attention. Review patient charts for completeness and accuracy.
Administer influenza vaccinations during the afternoon clinic. Pay close attention to patient allergies and contraindications before administering the vaccine. Document meticulously.
Review all patient charts for the day to ensure completeness and accuracy. Address any missing information or discrepancies. Prepare handover notes for the next shift.
Respond to emails and prepare for the next days shift, ensure the supplies are stocked.
